abstract: The date from the schedule that triggered the current view update.
overview:
## Discussion

The first time a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/TimelineView] closure receives this date, it might be in the past. For example, if you create an [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/TimelineSchedule/everyMinute] schedule at `10:09:55`, the schedule creates entries `10:09:00`, `10:10:00`, `10:11:00`, and so on. In response, the timeline view performs an initial update immediately, at `10:09:55`, but the context contains the `10:09:00` date entry. Subsequent entries arrive at their corresponding times.

# date

**Instance Property**

The date from the schedule that triggered the current view update.

## Declaration

```swift
let date: Date
```

## Discussion

The first time a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/TimelineView] closure receives this date, it might be in the past. For example, if you create an [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/TimelineSchedule/everyMinute] schedule at `10:09:55`, the schedule creates entries `10:09:00`, `10:10:00`, `10:11:00`, and so on. In response, the timeline view performs an initial update immediately, at `10:09:55`, but the context contains the `10:09:00` date entry. Subsequent entries arrive at their corresponding times.
title: date
